campaign.title: AI Customer Service
campaign.subject: Your customers expect instant responses. Here's how to deliver.
campaign.description: Using AI to provide 24/7 customer service without hiring more staff

slides.title: The Response Time Problem

stats.expectation: 90% of customers rate 'immediate' response as important
stats.definition: 'Immediate' means 10 minutes or less for most
stats.reality: Average small business response time: 12+ hours
stats.consequence: 59% will try a competitor if no quick response

slides.narration: Customers expect instant responses—ninety percent rate it as important. 'Immediate' means ten minutes or less to most customers. Average small business response time? Twelve hours or more. And fifty-nine percent will try a competitor if they don't get a quick response. The gap between expectation and reality is costing you customers.

slides.title: AI Customer Service
slides.narration: AI can handle customer service twenty-four seven. Instant responses—under thirty seconds, any time of day or night. Answer common questions about hours, pricing, services, policies. Book appointments—check availability, schedule, send confirmations. Handle initial complaint responses, escalate when needed. Follow up automatically—post-service check-ins, review requests. All without adding staff.

slides.title: Customer Experience

experience.experience: Instant answers, not 'someone will get back to you'

slides.narration: What do customers actually experience? Website chat—instant answers, not 'someone will get back to you.' Facebook message—same AI, consistent answers across channels. Text inquiry—a real conversation, not canned responses. After-hours call—not voicemail, actually answered and helped. Email question—response in minutes, not days. Every touchpoint covered, every time.

slides.title: Human + AI

content.headline: AI Handles Routine, Humans Handle Important
content.result: Your team has time for what matters

slides.narration: This isn't about replacing humans—it's about freeing them. AI handles the routine: standard questions, scheduling, basic info, initial acknowledgments, routine follow-ups. That's seventy to eighty percent of inquiries. Humans handle what matters: complex problems, upset customers, high-value opportunities, unique situations, relationship building. Your team has time for what only humans can do.

slides.title: Real Results

case_study.before: 3-4 hour average response time, missed after-hours inquiries
case_study.quote: We're booking appointments at 11pm now. That never happened before.

slides.narration: Real results. Medical spa with two locations. Before: three to four hour average response time, missing all after-hours inquiries. After: under two minute response time, twenty-four seven coverage. Results: ninety-eight percent improvement in response time, thirty-one percent more bookings, customer satisfaction up twenty-seven percent, front desk saved fifteen hours a week. The owner told us: 'We're booking appointments at 11pm now. That never happened before.'

slides.title: Getting Started

steps.action: Set up AI on your highest-traffic channel

slides.narration: Start with your highest-volume questions. Step one: list your ten most common questions. Step two: create clear answers for each. Step three: set up AI on your highest-traffic channel—probably website or Facebook. Step four: monitor and refine for two weeks. Step five: expand to other channels. Start simple, prove it works, then scale.

slides.title: Set Up AI Customer Service
slides.narration: Ready for twenty-four seven customer service? Set up AI service now—start with your top questions and expand from there. Or see a demo to see how it actually works. Your customers expect instant responses. Now you can deliver.
